text:
Hey, hey. So how is this our big double date
tonight?
Oh my God.
Ooh, great.
Just the reaction I was hoping for.

Ah, yeah. So you, uh, you found someone for
me you didn't forget?

Of course not. And you are gonna love Mary
Ellen.
She's really smart and cute and funny.

And I can't tell you how I know this, but
she is not opposed to threesomes.
Yeah. So tell me something about my guy.
No.
Come on, give me something.
What's his name?
Mike.
Mike?

Yeah. 
- Okay. What's his last name?

Damn it! Is there no mystery left in romance
anymore?

All right. We'll see you and Mike at the
restaurant in a couple hours.

All right. Great. 
- All right.
See ya. Bye bye.
Why did I have to say Mike?
I don't know, Mike. Why couldn't I said.
There's no guys in there.
Oh, it's impossible to find a good doctor.

I mean, how do you know the good ones from
the ones
who are going to push their pe**s against your knee?
Excuse me?
I know what she's talking about.

Uh, yeah. We've got to find a new
pediatrician.

Ross was getting sick last night, and I
think Emma may have caught it.
Why don't you go see Doctor Gettleman?
Ross said he died.
He didn't die.
I just saw his daughter last week.
Said he was fine.
Her, on the other hand, botched Botox.

Oh great. Well, then I'm going to take Emma to
see him.
I wonder why Ross said that he died.

Oh, maybe he was getting him confused with
his childhood therapist.
He saw a therapist?

Mm-hmm yeah. He used to have this recurring
nightmare
that just really freaked him out.
Why? What was it?
That I was going to eat him?
Mike.
Yeah.
Okay.

I got to tell you, I can't believe I'm doing
this with you.

Although I did just get out of a nine year
relationship, so I guess I should be open to
taking some risks.

Everything's going to be fine. Just follow
my lead, okay?
All you have to do is pretend to be Mike.

I am Mike. 
- Atta boy.

Here they come. 
- Hi.

Hi, Phoebe.
- Hey, Phoebe. I'm Mike.

Hi. How you doing?
- Nice to meet you.
Joey, this is Mary Ellen Jenkins.

So, Mike, how do you and Joey know each
other, anyway?
Uh, how do Joey and I know each other?

Wow. If I had a nickel for every time
somebody asked me that.
From school?
Yeah. We met in college.
I mean, high school.
Well, you guys go way back then.
So what are you up to these days?
Uh, well, I'm a lawyer.
Mike, attorney at law.
Actually, I just gave up my practice.

But that's the kind of thing you usually run
by me.

Well, I always wanted to play piano
professionally, and I figured if I don't do
this now, I never will.

Wow. That's great. I like that better than
the lawyer thing.

So which is why I waited until now to
introduce you to Mike.
I thought you thought he was still a lawyer.
No, no, no, that's not what I meant.
Let's. Let's get you a cocktail.
